headline: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
summary: 0706 GMT – Investors seem to be overreacting to the slowdown of  NetEase  gaming business, which is likely to be temporary,  Morningstar  analyst Ivan Su says in a note.  Concerns about the business’s near-term outlook were sparked after NetEase’s 2Q results showed weaker game revenue and mid-single-digit deferred income growth.  This fixation on a minor fluctuation in revenue is shortsighted, Su says, expecting NetEase’s commitment and patience in developing next-generation games to yield substantial rewards over time.

headline: China's video game achievement may be anomaly for years to come despite Black Myth: Wukong
summary: The Wukong mania that swept the nation shows how far the domestic video gaming industry has come in the last 10 years: Sony could not legally sell the PlayStation in China a decade ago, when the country was in its final year of a 15-year console ban.  China's first AAA video game - an unofficial designation that signifies high costs, long development times and the most demanding graphics - is proving to be a massive success.  It sold 10 million copies in less than four days, according to developer Game Science, and its peak simultaneous players measured by the digital game store Steam surged past other hit AAA titles such as Cyberpunk 2077 and Elden Ring.
